title: Introduction to Git and GitHub
text: In this lecture we will explore:

title: Introduction to Git and GitHub
text:
What is Git?

Git is a distributed version control system that tracks versions of files. It is often used to control source code by programmers who are developing software collaboratively.
Git is free and open-source software shared under the GPL-2.0-only license.
Git was originally created by Linus Torvalds for version control in the development of the Linux kernel.
Torvalds started developing Git in April 2005.
Torvalds sarcastically quipped about the name git (which is British English slang for an unpleasant or silly person): “I’m an egotistical bastard, and I name all my projects after myself. First ‘Linux’, now ‘git’.”

title: Introduction to Git and GitHub
text:
Why Git?



Image Credits: https://blog.codeitbro.com/funny-git-memes



Track history
Collaboration

title: Introduction to Git and GitHub
text:
What is GitHub?

GitHub is a proprietary developer platform that allows developers to create, store, manage, and share their code.
It is commonly used to host open source software development projects.
Its parent company is Microsoft.

title: Introduction to Git and GitHub
text:
Git VS GitHub

Git

A tool (software) installed on your computer.
A distributed version control system → tracks changes, manages history, branches, merging.
Works locally (you don’t even need the internet).



GitHub

A service/platform on the internet.
Hosts Git repositories in the cloud → makes collaboration easy.
Adds features on top of Git like pull requests, issues, project boards, CI/CD.

You can use Git without GitHub but you can not use Github without Git.



Image Credits: https://blog.codeitbro.com/funny-git-memes

title: Introduction to Git and GitHub
text:
Setting up Git

Credits: Anand Chitipothu website: anandology.github.io/isi-fcp

Install Git visit Git Installer
Setup git by configuring your name and email address in git.
$ git config --global user.name "V Sai Prabhav"
$ git config --global user.email "prabhav@example.com"
Please use your name and email address in the example above. Also, make sure the email address is same as what you have used when creating an account on github.

Setup ssk-key
$ ssh-keygen -t ed25519 -C my-name@my-laptop-name
That will output the following:
Generating public/private ed25519 key pair.
Enter file in which to save the key (/home/anand/.ssh/id_ed25519):
Just press Enter.


Adding ssk-key to GitHub
GitHub Guide


Create A GitHub repository


Clone your repository

Copy your ssh URL from your repo’s homepage. Code -> Local SSH -> Copy.
Open your terminal move to a working directory.

git clone git@github.com:Sai-Prabhav/bmath_notes.git
cd bmath_notes

title: Introduction to Git and GitHub
text:
Learning basic commands

Your best friend git status.
git add <file> to stage/track changes.

git add . to stage all files.

git commit -m "Commit message" to commit all your files.
git pull to get changes from upstream(GitHub) to your local.
git push to update your code to upstream(GitHub).
